oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Special Orders No. 3 discharging Lewis Hodge from military prison
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Special order released Lewis S. Hodge (written as "Hodges" on the document) from the military prison in Nashville, Tenn. in "consideration of his age and feeble health." He had been imprisoned on a charge of harboring guerillas. Hodge was from Lynnville, Tenn. The order is signed by Bvt. Maj. Gen. R. W. Johnson, Commander of the District of Middle Tennessee after the Civil War.
